meanings.definition: To refuse or be reluctant to do something.
meanings.sent1: She will unwill to eat vegetables.
meanings.sent2: He unwill to help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat unwill to come inside when it's raining.
meanings.sent4: The stubborn old tree unwill to bend in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The child unwill to share his toys with his sister.

meanings.definition: Lack of desire or willingness to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her unwill was evident in her lack of enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The team's unwill to cooperate led to their defeat.
meanings.sent3: The unwill of the sleepy students to pay attention was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The unwill of the river to change its course carved a deep canyon.
meanings.sent5: The unwill of the sun to set painted the sky in vibrant colors.
